title: Introducing: Hums
content:
The solo outfit of Elise from Minneapolis quartet Nice Purse, Hums may well be one of the most exciting new artists of the year; and that’s an assumption based upon only three tracks.

Far denser and more folk orientated than her primary band, there’s an added level of beauty to Hums’ music, part Sarah Jaffe, part Feist, two comparisons that I don’t make lightly. Of the trio of debut tracks, Going Places stands out as a future indie hit, with all the twee honesty associated with the UK female songwriters of mid-00’s (Allen, Nash etc.). As the tags suggest, it’s very much ‘pretty girl voice’, but who’s to say that can’t be brilliant? Deep In Swim, the debut LP from Hums is out later today.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
